course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Human Health &the Applied Arts
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 19 / Seats Avail: 3Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: The arts embody human experience and offer various modes of expression through which we explore our place in the world. Creativity offers opportunities for both health and wellness strategies and provides tools for healing. This course will combine research of existing methodologies with practical exploration in the fields of movement and visual art, interactive theater, and music to give students a first-hand look at and experience in applied arts in health.
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 2530, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: K. Hornbeck, Status: Open
